status: Indicates the format of a musical composition (e.g., piano-conductor score).

definition (en): Series of staves containing all the instrumental and/or vocal parts of a musical work, arranged so that they can be read simultaneously.

preferred label (en): full score, miniature or study size
definition (en): Miniature score that is usually smaller in size and not intended to be used in performances.
Accompaniment is reduced for keyboard instrument(s) and the vocal parts and/or solo instrumental parts remain the same.
scope note (en): Not used for scores of works for solo voices and chorus showing only the parts for chorus, at least in those portions of the work in which the chorus sings, with the instrumental accompaniment arranged for one or two keyboard instruments.

definition (en): A score for a vocal work with the accompaniment omitted.
scope note (en): Not used for vocal works originally unaccompanied.

definition (en): Orchestral or band music that has been reduced to a few staves. It may be part of an ensemble work for a particular instrument, with cues for other instruments. Such a score is used by an individual playing the instrument for which the score was written or for the conductor.
Close score (e.g., a hymnal) that has separate parts transcribed on two staves.

A score of a work for solo voices and chorus showing only the parts for chorus, at least in those portions of the work in which the chorus sings, with the instrumental accompaniment either arranged for one or two keyboard instruments or omitted.
A score in which the number of staves is reduced to two or a few, generally organized by instrumental sections, and often with cues for individual parts. Used for: Reduced score, Short score.
Score reduced to a single instrument for which the score was written or for the conductor.
Several types of scores are issued together, as is frequently the case with band music.
Format of the item is unknown.

Format of music other than full score, full score, miniature or study size, accompaniment reduced for keyboard, voice score, condensed score or piano-conductor score, close score, multiple score formats.
